meanings.definition: Relating to the act of distributing or the process of being distributed.
meanings.sent1: The distributional process ensures everyone gets their fair share.
meanings.sent2: The distributional system in place helps divide resources equally.
meanings.sent3: The distributional challenge was like a puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was distributional, spreading joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The distributional nature of the task made it complex yet rewarding.

meanings.definition: Involving the arrangement or spread of something over an area or among a group.
meanings.sent1: The distributional pattern of stars in the sky fascinated astronomers.
meanings.sent2: The distributional map showed where the different species were located.
meanings.sent3: The distributional game at the party was a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was distributional, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The distributional layout of the garden made it visually appealing.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the allocation or delivery of goods or resources.
meanings.sent1: The distributional center ensured timely delivery of packages.
meanings.sent2: The distributional process of food to the shelters was efficient.
meanings.sent3: The distributional mix-up of gifts led to some funny surprises.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was distributional, always willing to share what he had.
meanings.sent5: The distributional efficiency of the team impressed their supervisor.
